parameter 1: Now available on Region 3 DVD from MGM is the Director's Cut.  Now, although this is basically the same as the Anchor Bay version, it is compiled from original source prints and not from a VHS source, as Anchor Bay's was. Not only that, it offers 5.1 sound and the scene where Bad Ash tears off Shelia's dress top has been added back.  A must-have for any collector of this film.
parameter 2: The Australian/Japanese special edition is identical to the UK video version.
parameter 3: Now available on Region 3 DVD from MGM is the Director's Cut.  Now, although this is basically the same as the Anchor Bay version, it is compiled from original source prints and not from a VHS source, as Anchor Bay's was. Not only that, it offers 5.1 sound and the scene where Bad Ash tears off Shelia's dress top has been added back.  A must-have for any collector of this film.
parameter 4: The Australian/Japanese special edition is identical to the UK video version.
parameter 5: Now available on Region 3 DVD from MGM is the Director's Cut.  Now, although this is basically the same as the Anchor Bay version, it is compiled from original source prints and not from a VHS source, as Anchor Bay's was. Not only that, it offers 5.1 sound and the scene where Bad Ash tears off Shelia's dress top has been added back.  A must-have for any collector of this film.
parameter 6: In the theatrical version Merlin (Wiseman) tells Ash to drink the potion and say the words in order to get back to his own time. In the director's cut he tells him to drink six drops, (one drop for each century) this leads to the "downer" ending.
parameter 7: Now available on Region 3 DVD from MGM is the Director's Cut.  Now, although this is basically the same as the Anchor Bay version, it is compiled from original source prints and not from a VHS source, as Anchor Bay's was. Not only that, it offers 5.1 sound and the scene where Bad Ash tears off Shelia's dress top has been added back.  A must-have for any collector of this film.
parameter 8: The Australian/Japanese special edition is identical to the UK video version.
parameter 9: The Australian/Japanese special edition is identical to the UK video version.
parameter 10: The cable TV version, though extended, cuts out the decapitation of pit Deadite, the skeletons' "We've got plans for you, girly-girl!" female slaves, and all profanity, including (sometimes) Ash's name. "Assholes" becomes "apeheads," and "bastards" becomes "buzzards."
parameter 11: A short 2 second shot is shown on the Japanese "Captain Supermarket" Laserdisc and on all MGM/Fox DVD releases: After Sheila is first captured and presented to Evil Ash, He rips Sheila's dress down to her waist. Explaining the next shot of looking her up and down. The following shot of the nude slave girls is also much clearer.
parameter 12: A short 2 second shot is shown on the Japanese "Captain Supermarket" Laserdisc and on all MGM/Fox DVD releases: After Sheila is first captured and presented to Evil Ash, He rips Sheila's dress down to her waist. Explaining the next shot of looking her up and down. The following shot of the nude slave girls is also much clearer.
parameter 13: The Australian/Japanese special edition is identical to the UK video version.
parameter 14: Alternate Dialogue: In the theatrical release, when the evil Ash is mocking good Ash, Good Ash shoots Evil Ash with the shotgun and says, "Good or Evil, I'm the one with the shotgun." In the director's cut version he says, "I'm not that good."

parameter 19: MGM/Fox have also released an Army of Darkness DVD in Regions 2,4 and 5. It is the international theatrical cut of the film, which while longer than the US theatrical version, is shorter than the Directors Cut and includes the S-Mart ending. Runtime: 85:07 (PAL).
